news.title: Conor McGregor yet to be served summons over alleged sexual assault in US as case stalls
news.summary: A US civil lawsuit in which a woman has accused Conor McGregor of sexual assault has stalled as the wait for officials to serve a court summons on the mixed martial arts fighter drags on.

news.title: Ireland set to sizzle as sun-lovers enjoy 30C on hottest day of year; parks to offer free sunscreen
Supermarkets deny price gouging as minister promises action on soaring food bills
news.summary: Supermarkets have hit back at accusations of price gouging, insisting their prices are competitive and profit ­margins are low.

news.title: Katie Taylor’s $6m New York fight bonanza
news.summary: Katie Taylor and Amanda Serrano go head-to-head for a third time in just over three years in the early hours of tomorrow morning for another multi-million pay day that has elevated the female fight game to another level.

news.title: Israeli airstrike kills 10 children near Gaza clinic as IDF says it was targeting militant; no immediate truce in sight
news.summary: An Israeli airstrike hit Palestinians near a medical centre in Gaza on Thursday, killing 10 children and six adults, local health authorities said, as ceasefire talks dragged on with no immediate deal expected.

news.title: Calls for temperature limits in workplaces as absences expected to rise in hot weather
news.summary: An increase in absences is expected as heatwave forecasts have led to calls for temperature limits in workplaces.

news.title: Modern Morals: My friend applied for a role at my job and wants me to put in a good word – but how can I when I know what I know?
How ‘mini Downton Abbey’ in Cork offered quirky childhood with coach house, priest holes and over six acres
‘I used to miss flights and lose phones. Now I’ve saved almost €6,000 in three years’ – the financial benefits of quitting drinking
news.summary: “I didn’t trust myself to have a credit card until I got sober,” says Saz Cartin, as she lists the financial benefits of sobriety.

news.title: Are you being replaced by AI? The five Irish jobs most at risk
news.summary: Artificial intelligence is starting to replace Irish workers, from content moderators and junior software engineers to financial services graduates.
